page.title: 19Newspapers in Romsey
page.content: Mr.Terry Viney (Editor of the Romsey Avertiser) was born in 1933 and thinks his family may originally have been French. He was educated in Romsey until he won a scholarship to Barton Peveril School in Eastleigh. Mr. Viney has lived in Romsey all his life and worked for the Advertiser since 1952. The first paper in Romsey was called 'The Romsey Register'. It started in 1854 and continued until 1894. The 'Romsey South Hants Chronicle' started in 1876 and finished in 1887. The 'Romsey Standard' started in 1883 and finished in 1884.The Romsey Advertiser was a branch of the Andover Advertiser Before the Second World War the Romsey Advertiser produced 10 pages in each paper and long and detailed reports but this was reduced to 4 pages during the war. In the 60's papers were enlarged and were more eye catching.
